text: A number of units of measurement were used in Uruguay to measure quantities. Metric system was optional in Uruguay since 1866, and has been compulsory since 1894. ==System before metric system== The older system was the Spanish (Castilian) system with some modification. ===Mass=== One libra was equal to 460 g (1.014286 lb). ===Capacity=== One fanega was equal to 274 l (7.776 bushels). ==References== Category:Uruguayan culture Uruguay
title: Uruguayan units of measurement
